The Act may be cited as the "Brownfields Utilization, Investment, and Local Development Act of 2013" or the "BUILD Act". Expanded eligibility for nonprofit organizations is also included in the Act. Section 104(k)(1) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include expanded eligibility for nonprofit organizations, limited liability corporations, and limited partnerships. Expanded eligibility for nonprofit organizations, limited liability corporations, and limited partnerships in Section 104(k)(1) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. SEC. 3. MULTIPURPOSE BROWNFIELDS GRANTS. Section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to establish a program for multipurpose brownfields grants to eligible entities for various activities related to inventory, characterization, assessment, planning, or remediation. The program offers grants for activities at brownfield sites, with individual grants not exceeding $950,000. The total grants awarded in a fiscal year cannot exceed 15% of the funds available. Criteria for awarding grants include the ability to provide an overall plan. The program offers grants for activities at brownfield sites, with individual grants not exceeding $950,000. Eligible entities must demonstrate the capacity to conduct eligible activities and show that the grant will meet the needs of the brownfield sites. Grant recipients must spend the full amount within three years of receiving the grant. Grant recipients must spend the full amount within three years of receiving the grant, unless an extension is granted by the Administrator. SEC. 4 amends the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act to allow governmental entities to receive grants for brownfield sites acquired before January 11, 2002. SEC. 5 increases funding for remediation grants. SEC. 5 increases funding for remediation grants from $200,000 to $500,000 per site, with a possible waiver up to $650,000 based on contamination level, size, or ownership status. SEC. 6 allows grant recipients to use funds for administrative costs. The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include changes in administrative costs. The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to allow eligible entities to use up to 8 percent of grant or loan amounts for administrative costs, excluding investigation, design, performance of response actions, and natural resource monitoring. SEC. 7. SMALL COMMUNITY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE. Amends section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 to prioritize small communities, Indian tribes, rural areas, or low-income areas with a population of not more than 15,000 individuals for technical assistance programs. SEC. 8. WATERFRONT BROWNFIELDS GRANTS. Section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include provisions for waterfront brownfield sites adjacent to bodies of water or federally designated floodplains. Grants under this subsection will consider and prioritize waterfront brownfield sites. SEC. 9. CLEAN ENERGY BROWNFIELDS GRANTS. Section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include a program for clean energy projects at brownfield sites, providing grants for renewable energy facilities and energy efficiency improvements. The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include a program for clean energy projects at brownfield sites. Grants up to $500,000 are provided for activities such as inventory, assessment, planning, and remediation, as well as for establishing a revolving loan fund. SEC. 10. TARGETED FUNDING FOR STATES.

The Administrator may use up to $2,000,000 to provide grants to States for authorized purposes, with the condition that each State must have used at least 50% of the previous year's funding for assessment and remediation activities.

SEC. 11. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. SEC. 11. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends funding years in environmental response and revitalization programs.
